item.title: Ok simple problem its weird hope u can help =)
item.dc:creator: @Mod_Adam Adam
item.description:
@Mod_Adam wrote:

Here’s what I have, I think this is all of it.

[code] public String censorStr(String str)
{
String temp = str;
try
{
BufferedReader in = new BufferedReader(new FileReader(“data/censor.txt”));
String data = null;
while ((data = in.readLine()) != null)
{
String temp2 = data;
temp = temp.replaceAll(temp2, GenerateC(temp2.length()));
}
}
catch (IOException e)
{
System.out.println(“Critical error while checking is a censored word”);
e.printStackTrace();
}
return temp;

}[/code]

        String temp2 = censorStr(temp);

Then in your data folder, create a file called “censor”

Then put a word that gets blocked, go down a line, put another, etc…

item.title: Ok simple problem its weird hope u can help =)
item.dc:creator: @Mod_Adam Adam
item.description:
@Mod_Adam wrote:

Palidino76:

You cannot do this server side unless your a really good coder, and I think it would involve editing your player.java, because when you talk its just a packet loading, you could make it so that if they say a bad word something happens to them, but as far as i know you cannot edit text server side like that.

I actually have this added to my server, so we can knock off your theory. The only thing wrong with it, is it doesn’t block it to the player who said it. But it blocks it to everyone else.

item.title: Ok simple problem its weird hope u can help =)
item.dc:creator: @yppman yppman
item.description:
@yppman wrote:

This won’t work, know why? Because customcommand is only called when the player puts a :: before it. So if they did ::curse it would end up as ::***** but if you just says it nothing would change =]

What you want to do is add the trim to the code that dishes out all the things people are saying to the other players.
